text:
1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start homesteading in Western Canada? 1904

Where did you set up homestead? Manitoba

Where had you been living before that? Self

For how many people did you prepare meals? 4-7

How far was it to your nearest store? 4-7 miles to Lorne Creek

How often could a visit be made to the store? Year-round with W. Pinchin

What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?

Sugar, Salt, Coffee, Potatoes, Wheat, Lye, Sugar

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Moorely

In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs.

What was the total price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.95

How much did you use graham flour? None

Was wheat flour used? No

Was flour milled locally? No

What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal, Other

Did you grind your own wheat for flour? Only as above

How did you grind it? Coffee mill
3. SUGAR AND SUGAR PRODUCTS

In what quantity did you buy? At what price? $1.50 per lb.

What was the price for a ton point sack of unrefined sugar? $5.00 per lb.

What brand of golden syrup did you use? Regent's, Hazlewood's, etc.

What size of tin or can did you normally buy? 20 oz.

Did you remember at that price?

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you store milk in the early days? None.

With what container? Glass jars, milk bottles.

That was the price of butter? 40¢ per lb., 85¢ per lb., etc.

Did you make extra for storage? Yes, No.

Was it stored in a cool place? Yes, No.

Did you make butter? Yes, No.

What kind of cheese? Cheddar, Mozzarella, etc.

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Poultry.

Would you eat bacon often? Yes, No.

As a rule, how often did you get fresh meat? Weekly, Monthly.

How often did you get fresh meat? Weekly, Monthly.

How did you preserve meat? Cured, Smoked.

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? No.

If so, what year was it organized? ______

Did you use farms? Yes, No.

For how long? ______

Was part of the fish sold in the city? Yes, No.

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Fresh.

Was the fish cooked, baked, or steamed? Baked.

Kinds? ______
6. **NEW MARKET**

   - What kind of tea did you buy? Each pound for $1.25.
   - What kind of coffee did you buy? (beans or ground) Both, but mostly beans.
   - Price? $3.50.
   - That other beverage was usual? No.

7. **VEGETABLES AND DRIED FRUITS**

   - What was the price of potatoes per bushel when you got up housekeeping?
   - If so, where from?
   - That year did you first grow your own supply for the winter?
   - Potatoes $0.45.
   - Turnips $0.50.
   - Beans $0.50.
   - Cabbages $0.45.
   - Carrots $0.50.
   - Onions $0.50.
   - How did you buy prunes, (in bulk or by the box)?
   - What weight? 10 lbs.
   - How did the grocer handle prunes (by box)? Yes.
   - What was the price of prunes? $1.00.
   - That other dried fruits did you use in the simplest days? (apricots, peaches, apricots, prunes, lumberrubus, raisins, currants or others)?
   - In the early years did you preserve any? No.
   - Peas? No.
   - Corn? No.
   - Beans? No.
   - Other foods? No.
   - That year did you first preserve fruit by canning? No.
   - That year did you first preserve vegetables by canning? No.
   - That year did you first preserve meat by canning? No.
   - Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying? No.
   - To what extent? 75%.
   - Did you make your own vinegar? No.
6. **New Crops**
   - What kind of tea did you buy? Each Blend for one tab for $5.
   - What kind of coffee did you buy? (beans or ground) Roast, half-pantry.
   - Price: $3.50 but other beverages were usual.

7. **Vegetables and Canned Fruits**
   - What was the price of potatoes per bushel?
   - Could you get potatoes at the store?
   - How did you first grow your own? For the winter crop?
   - What year did you first grow your own?
   - In what quantities did you buy?
   - How did you buy potatoes? (in bulk or by the box)?
   - What weight? (lbs.)
   - How did the grower usually price? (per box)?
   - What was the price of prunes?
   - What other dried fruits did you use in the past? (apricots, peaches, lemons, raisins, currants, etc.)?

8. **Preserving**
   - In the early years did you preserve any foods by canning?
   - Beans?
   - Tomatoes?
   - What year did you first preserve fruit by canning?
   - What year did you first preserve vegetables by canning?
   - Do you still preserve foods by canning or other?
   - To what extent?
   - Did you make your own vinegar?

10. Baking
What type of yeast did you use? Yeast
Did you make yeast for your own use? No
Using hops? No
Salt rising? No
Did you buy butter powder? No
Cream of tartar? No
Did you take your own baking powder? No
Generally when Savan
Demans became Delano
shopping centering
while the freezing

10. DATING
What type of yeast did you use? Bakers
Did you make yeast for your own use? No
Using hops? No
Did you buy baking powder? Yes
Baking soda? Yes
Or was tartaric acid used? No

13. SOAP
Did you buy laundry soap or make your own?
If you made your own, did you use lye? Yes
What kind of laundry soap did you use? Royal Crown

14. FUEL
What fuel did you use in the earliest days?
There did you not your fuel?
What kind of fuel did you use?
From Indiana Forest Service

Function any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

Not until I had left no later date except for water cook.

15. METHODS OF COOKING AND TYPES OF UTENSILS
For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest days? (Give dates) No
Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates) No
By whom was your first cook stove made? Belknap Galena
That year was it purchased? 1904
That type of utensil was used? Tin (iron)
For preparing food? Glass, earthenware, wooden bowls, other
Then did you first use aluminum? No Needleskin
13. SOAP

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? Yes.

If you made your own, did you use 197? No.

What kind of laundry soap did you purchase? Royal Cleaner.

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the outdoor stove? Wood.

Have you used any other type of fuel? No.

Did you use any alternative fuels such as wood, coal, etc.? No.

First started burning wood, then shifted to oil. No.

Not until last fall. No.

Except for winter coat.

15. HEATERS AND TYPES OF FUELS

For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the parlor? No.

Days? (Give dates) Have heaters to keep gardens.

Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates) No.

By whom was your first cook stove maker? P.O. Co.

That year was it purchased? 1904.

What type of stove? (Iron, copper, tin, brass)

Price? $28.5

Then did you have a woodburning stove? Yes.

Then did you have an aluminum stove? No.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible.)

During first world war.

Was married in 1913 and had two children.
